reviews.review_msg: Lectures are redundant and often boring due to the material but Mike tries to keep lectures as entertaining as possible. Quizzes are lecture heavy so it's worth it to attend classes. Majority of your final grade depends entirely on your TA.

Good professor and good sense of humor. Lecture slides he posted were also very detailed so easy to catch up if you miss a lecture. Make sure to do all the readings and practice quizzes as he recycles a lot of quiz questions as well as tests from the readings. Overall if you manage your time in this class it shouldn't be too difficult
not a bad guy explained everything you need for final exam. He'll be a five if he share his legos and that giant monitor with me

Engaging in lectures and actually has slides that can be followed if you miss a lecture. Nothing too notable about the class cuz it felt a bit redundant for an engineering writing class- though I'm sure it's good foundational stuff. Very organized class material and lecture style.

Make sure you always attend classes and take notes. lectures are boring but he keeps it entertaining with his jokes. Don't procrastinate your papers. Aim to finish them a week in advance so you have a while for peer review.

This is a writing class, you write an informative paper on an engineering topic and adapt it into a persuasive paper. Make sure you start writing early on, even if it's just note-taking. It really sucks when you leave note-taking and writing till the last week. Mike is approachable and funny and his quizzes are very similar to the practice quizzes.
Mike was an great prof. He makes a lot of funny jokes and examples during lectures. His quizzes are based on the practice quiz that he gave you.

One of my favorite profs! Once you get to know him he's very approachable and great to talk to. The course content was somewhat bland but I don't like writing and it was a writing course. He knows how to teach and is methodical in the way he goes about his lectures. He is also very respectful towards students. Main issue was bad TAs.

His lectures are great, although he isn't the nicest to all his students. I was pointed out to be quiet during a guest lecture, even though it was the group directly in front of me talking and not me. He talked to me after about it saying it was very rude, and he didn't accept my explanation. His lectures are great though.

He's many engineering students' introduction to university and for that role, he is not a bad choice. Lectures are clear and easy to follow, and the topics chosen are varied and interesting enough to get students interested for the rest of the degree.
Quizzes were too broad which made it really difficult to study for. The persuasive paper is 40% of your mark so spend a lot of time on that. He's a pretty funny professor though.

Mike grades on a curve. I did well on the paper which meant I did well in the class. The quizzes were tough and the average was low, but the curve boosted me. Attend the lectures and read the textbook and youll get a good grade. The group project is easy as well.

Lectures are okay, but don't teach you enough to do well in the class. If it wasn't mandatory and graded, I'd say stay home and read the text book. Honestly, I got the second highest mark on the midterm by just binge-reading the textbook in the week before. The average was about half of my grade. Decent teacher, but the text is more useful.

I enjoyed Mike's class a lot, he is an engaging lecturer and has a good sense of humour. The group project will become tedious but it was a good experience nonetheless. The final paper is essential to doing well, so make sure you put in the effort. Quizzes are based on readings AND lectures, he'll give hints in lecture on what will be on the quiz.

The first 'Group Project' class of engineering. However... The persuasive paper is worth 40% of your grade. Start thinking about what you want to write early, and FOLLOW THE RUBRIC. Seriously. The paper's worth double the entire group project.
He's an ok guy, but the material that he is teaching is a real torture!! The textbook ideas are not well organized making it very difficult to keep track of.
He has no clear Grading criteria on Group project.

Mike is reasonable and usually teaches pretty easy but necessary stuff. If you go to lectures, you literally cannot fail. He post really helpful previous exams that help you learn and prep. Always take Mike.

well 204 was hard for me but mike was helpful during his office hours.  do all his assignment very carefully , don't copy from previous years. Midterm was ok and final was hard except the m/c questions  try to read the entire text book and all his notes carefully to get most of m/c right because the rest of final was pretty hard
That one credit course ruins my GPA. Even I have passed 251 and 252, but failed this 204!!
Friendly enough guy, although lectures tend to be boring , did not really learn that much from this class.
What bother teaching!? Go back to raw forest and ruin your position as a chair of industry

He doesn't mind ruin on students' GPA. Too much hw & mandatory attendance, makes me feel like I'm back in high school. If I pay for the course, I should've had the  right to not show up & not lose marks. All W courses are like this, Hum or His...

Why the bad reviews? I think the negative reviews here are more about the classes than Mike himself. He's incredibly coherent, well spoken, and friendly. His classes like many ENSC classes feel like you're always with a group of friends. Don't slack off just because his classes are 1 credit, it's real course work and you need to put in real effort.
Bad grader i have ever seen and there is no concept that how the grade is given.

He is a sub par professor. It's time like these one wonders why a person like him has a degree. He refuses to apply knowledge outside the textbook. His inability to comprehend the fact that science is moving at a rapid pace and possibilities are endless makes the class less than enjoyable. If you want a good grade, I suggest lowering your IQ.

Textbook was completely unnecessary. He was able to turn a very dry subject into a relatively interesting one. Grades were quite fair and course was structured so that you can't procrastinate on researching your paper.
not a nice instructor, no scaling , TA grading is horrible...
It is one credit course, but it feels like 400 level course with mike....Terrible, he will scale you about how hard the final is gonna be. Trust him on this.
Great Prof. Although if your not an engineering major, I wouldn't take this course. Seems easy but it can be frustrating for many people.

Unlike other profs, he does not scale grades. He strictly follows the grading scheme (below 50% is F, 50-59 is D, etc). For example, he will not hesitate to give F to the whole class even if the class average is well below 50%. I should have taken 406 when Craig Scratchley was responsible.

Smart and able to communicate clearly. Not too much work was required. The ethics portion was interesting. Exams focused a little too much on the law aspect, which was just reciting from memory. Tutorials were the most enjoyable hour of my week.

I don`t understand why this guy wants to make this useless 2 credit course such hard for students. This course involves a lot of work as those 3+ credit courses do, and you might get a bad grade even you thought you study hard. Mike, stop giving students a hard time by teaching this BS course, it won`t show how brilliant you are.
I don't know why those people on the other page gave him such bad reviews. Mike is AWESOME. Great sense of humour and great at explaining things. Class was easy.
This guy is awesome.

Mike Sjoerdsma is hilarious as can be. Takes a horribley dry course and made it one of my favorites this semester (behind ENSC 100 with john jones) He is good at explaining things, and you should take a course with him even if you don't need it.
Great teacher :)He's a funny guy. This course was great in welcoming us to university.
seems like he has a lot of pride in himself. really funny guy though

Very good prof. He is very good at conveying concepts that are quite abstract. Provides lots of examples. Assignments were short but somewhat difficult. Midterm and final were very fair. Marking was fair. He doesn't seem to be as bad as old reviews would suggest. I found it very easy to get an A+ in this course, but I do find this stuff fairly easy
one of the worst profs in sfu engineering. bad attitude, bad teaching, bad grading, and it goes on...
He absolutly hates students! he mkes you work so hard for a useless 2 credit course. at the end leaves you with a bad grade....

I dont know why he chose teaching as his career because he clearly hates it! he doesnt care about the coarse load so he gives you lots of hard things to do, gives you extremly hard exams and then gives you a horrible mark at the end! "COOL DWN MIKE ITS JUST A ONE CREDIT COARSE"!

He puts you through huge course load and at the end give you an extremely unfair mark. Amount of the work required for this 1 credit course is more than most of 400 level courses you may take! I don't know what is he trying to prove by putting lots of pressure on students and giving them very low marks in his stupid 1 credit course!
He is picky and his course is subjective.  An easy to pass course but it lowers your GPA unless your GPA is low
Easy tests/ quizzes, as long as you listened him in the lectures. Eventhough you don't attend the lectures, you will do just fine. He's really helpful and a cool guy

Mike is awesome. He's a very well-rounded professor and is bound to make it big someday. This is just his second semester of teaching and he already smokes the veterans. I suppose part of his charm is that he was just a student not too long ago. Something the old farts have forgotten about.
Good guy, cares a lot about the students, easy to understand and follow. Final exam was fair and pretty easy, even though I didn't pay attention/show-up to half the classes.
